meanings.definition: The act of moving from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transmigrations of birds during migration season are fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The transmigrations of people from rural areas to cities have increased over the years.
meanings.sent3: The transmigrations of ants from one anthill to another can be quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The transmigrations of clouds across the sky create a beautiful ever-changing canvas.
meanings.sent5: The transmigrations of fish in the ocean are essential for their survival.

meanings.definition: The process of passing from one state or form to another.
meanings.sent1: The transmigrations of water from liquid to vapor form the water cycle.
meanings.sent2: The transmigrations of technology from old to new models happen rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The transmigrations of colors in a kaleidoscope are mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The transmigrations of seasons from winter to spring bring new life to the world.
meanings.sent5: The transmigrations of ideas from one mind to another spark innovation.

meanings.definition: The belief in the migration of the soul from one body to another after death.
meanings.sent1: The transmigrations of souls in reincarnation are a central tenet in many religions.
meanings.sent2: The transmigrations of spirits in folklore often involve ghost stories.
meanings.sent3: The transmigrations of ghosts in haunted houses make for spooky tales.
meanings.sent4: The transmigrations of energy from one form to another are a scientific concept.
meanings.sent5: The transmigrations of memories from one generation to the next shape our identities.
